name: Hotel Miramonte

reviews.text: With a panoramic view overlooking the valley far below you can easily find peace and relaxation. Also billed as an adventure hotel location oddly only 1 bike is available and rafting trips can be planned -- though we inquired, but no one ever followed up. The food is included in the price and it's a good deal. Breakfast is a full spread of fruit, meat, cheese, yogurts and bread. Dinner is simple with four small, but filling courses with options -- our fish was dry and the vegetarian option uninspiring.
reviews.title: 1950's Meets Trendy Chic Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: The design of the hotel is inspired by its original 50's roots with splashes of modern design, but it does show its age. Wifi is freely available, but coverage is spotty. There is also a spa, but we didn't try it. The hotel uses Aveda soaps.
reviews.title: Devoted to relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like your hotels to have the functionality and uniformity of a Marriott or Sheraton, then give this a miss.
reviews.title: Good but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But if you believe a hotel should be a place to escape, to relax and to switch off, then this is a wonderful place.
reviews.title: Great hotel for non-skiers, I would say one of the best in the town!

reviews.text: The views are stunning, the service is superb and the style is individual.
reviews.title: Urban chique in prime skiing area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice Hotel with a composition of old and new Design, friendly Personal, good food and large Rooms with a marvelous view on the Mountains and into the valley.
reviews.title: Living there forever

reviews.text: A nice, newly renovated hotel with very basic (but comfortable and with style decorated) rooms (with a magnificent view if you have the panorama room - it's worth it) and bathroom. The spa is great, haven't tried the roman spa, but the dry sauna and the resting area is great. the staff is very friendly. However, they do not provide enough parking lots for all the guests.
reviews.title: Nice, romantic Miramonte

likes.disliked: — You can clearly hear the neighbours and the conversations and noise from the hall.

reviews.title: Great rooms, excelent food, unforgettable view of Gastein valley

likes.disliked: — Far from the centre of Bad Gastein

reviews.text: This was a summer experience of the Austrian Alps and the Miramonte is perfectly situated with fantastic room views of both the Sportgastein area and the valley below. We were extremely impressed with the interior of the hotel but more so at the overall atmosphere which was comfortable, not ostentatious or arrogant as you may expect from such high quality.
reviews.title: Stylish, comfortable and well looked after

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good bar, spa, comfortable beds and reasonable price makes this a definite recommend for the area. *****
reviews.title: Very cool, will definitely be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to get away for one night and drove to Bad Gastein, Austria. After reading about the Miramonte in a magazine we booked and got a nice deal on the room, breakfast and dinner. Normally you don't expect much from the breakfast and dinner options but we were pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Great Spa and ski hotel

reviews.text: Firstly though the drive to the hotel is amazing. It's perched on the mountain high above the valley floor and looks like it should be in Casino Royale with a roof top sign, wooden decking and a very windy road down to the entrance. While it wasn't busy, check in was pleasant and the desk staff friendly and attentive. The room was great, we didn't have a great view but it was clean and had some nice touches plus the bathroom was huge and very clean.
reviews.title: calm and cosy with sophisicate food and frindly attendance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the bar that night and they have an extensive cocktail list although we'd like to have seen some signature cocktails rather than the typical drinks you can get at the apres ski disco but this is a minor thing. The service was pretty good and the drinks well made. The lounge area is super cool and if the weather had been better we'd have been able to enjoy our drinks outside on the sun lounger deck. The dining room is connected to the bar and we went next door to find a selection of main courses. The food was great and un-like most places was a good portion. The service was excellent. Same story with the breakfast, a buffet with a great selection of cereal, hot and cold options and pastries.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

description: A new budget & design hotel for the creative as well as dog lovers.
